member.name: IEnumFullIDList.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new item enumeration object with the same contents and state as the current one.
member.param: On success, contains the address of an interface pointer.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IEnumFullIDList.Next
member.summary: Retrieves a specified number of IDLIST_ABSOLUTE items.
member.param: The number of items referenced in the array referenced by the rgelt parameter.
On success, contains a PIDL array. The implementation must allocate these item identifiers using . The calling application is responsible for freeing the item identifiers using .

On success, contains a pointer to a value that receives a count of the absolute item identifiers actually returned in rgelt. The count can be smaller than the value specified in the celt parameter. This parameter can be NULL on entry only if celt is 1, because in that case the method can only retrieve one (S_OK) or zero (S_FALSE) items.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if the method successfully retrieved the requested celt elements. This method only returns S_OK if the full count of requested items are successfully retrieved.

S_FALSE indicates that more items were requested than remained in the enumeration. The value pointed to by the pceltFetched parameter specifies the actual number of items retrieved. Note that the value will be 0 if there are no more items to retrieve.
Returns a COM-defined error value otherwise.

member.name: IEnumFullIDList.Reset
member.summary: Returns the enumerator to the beginning of the enumeration sequence.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IEnumFullIDList.Skip
member.summary: Skips a specified number of IDLIST_ABSOLUTE items.
member.param: The number of items to skip.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IEnumFullIDList
member.summary: Exposes a standard set of methods that enumerate the pointers to item identifier lists (PIDLs) of the items in a Shell folder.
